meanings.definition: To reevaluate or reassess the value or significance of something.
meanings.sent1: She transvaluates her priorities every year to make sure she is focusing on what truly matters.
meanings.sent2: The company transvaluates its budget regularly to ensure financial stability.
meanings.sent3: John transvaluates his collection of baseball cards to see which ones are worth the most.
meanings.sent4: The artist transvaluates the meaning of beauty through his abstract paintings.
meanings.sent5: The teacher transvaluates the importance of education by sharing inspiring stories with her students.

meanings.definition: To change or shift the values or beliefs associated with something.
meanings.sent1: The new evidence transvaluates our understanding of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: Experiencing different cultures can transvaluates one's perspective on life.
meanings.sent3: The magic show transvaluates the audience's perception of reality.
meanings.sent4: The book transvaluates the traditional concept of heroism in a modern setting.
meanings.sent5: Traveling to new places can transvaluates your opinions on different customs and traditions.
